text_blocks.text: Let us speak of {player}. A functional human being who, much like the rest of us, was busy doing absolutely nothing of historical importance.
Then, gravity took a lunch break. A silver sphere fell onto the table. It didn't roll. It sat there, heavy with implication.
{player} touched it. And just like that, the metal dissolved into their skin, warm and inviting, like tea on a rainy afternoon.
Meanwhile, half a world away, {partner} was minding their own business, blissfully unaware that the universe was about to file a complaint.
The device found them too. It bonded. No pain, just a sudden realization that the world was suddenly much larger.
The two devices woke up. A pulse went out. Invisible to the eye, but felt by the soul. It mapped the planet. Every hidden bunker, every lost shipwreck.
Teleportation is a rude way to travel. One moment you are home, the next you are standing on the sky. The Salar de Uyuni. The great mirror of Bolivia.
{player} spotted a figure in the distance. {partner}. They looked equally disheveled, scanning the horizon.
They approached each other. No grand speeches. Just the awkward nod of two people who realize they are stuck in the same lifeboat.
The sun began to dip. The beauty of the salt flats is treacherous; without shelter, the cold kills you with a smile. They needed a vehicle.
Gravity bent. A **Nissan X-Trail T31** slammed onto the salt. Pearl White. 2.0L Diesel Turbo. The kind of car that says, 'I have a mortgage, but I can cross a river.'
Gravity bent. A **Nissan X-Trail T31** materialized. Pearl White. The M9R diesel engine ticked over with a rhythmic clatter‚Äîpure mechanical music.
OOOOH I LIKEEEE. That engine sound? Chef's kiss ahahah üòù. You two have taste!
{player} and {partner} jumped. The voice didn't come from the car speakers. It came from their wrists. It came from *inside* their heads.
I'm Smylynx. I handle the logistics. Look at that panoramic sunroof! That's massive! Perfect for stargazing while you run for your lives ü•∞.
{partner} opened the glovebox. There was a heavy, reassuring clunk. A cache of ammunition. No guns‚Äîjust the ammo. A polite suggestion from the universe.
{player} took the driver's seat. The manual gear stick felt cold and precise. They dropped the clutch. The X-Trail didn't just accelerate; it tore a hole in the silence.
4x4 Lock engaged. Sending torque to the rear wheels. Don't be shy, push it! I want to see what this 2.0L can do!
They hit 100km/h. The salt spray looked like snow. The air was freezing, but {player} felt... fine. Better than fine. Their heart was racing, but their muscles felt flooded with oxygen.
That's the Bio-Regen, honey. You feel like you're dying? Nope. You're at 95% capacity. I'm scrubbing the lactic acid from your blood in real-time. Keep driving!
{player} drifted the car. The wheels slipped on a patch of wet salt. The car slid sideways, heading straight for a jagged salt ridge.
Whoa there, speed racer! üò® Kinetic Dampers deployed!

A shimmer of purple light enveloped the car. The impact never came. The force field nudged them back onto the smooth track. They were invincible. They were fast. And they were very, very far from home.
